body_content.explanation: an occasion when something or someone falls quickly under the influence of gravity (= the force that attracts objects towards one another, especially the force that makes things fall to the ground):
examples: Skydivers are propelled into a 70-second freefall at 120mph before their parachutes open.
Finishing its climb, the plane abruptly goes into free fall straight down.

body_content.explanation: the process of failing or losing value or strength quickly and continuously:
examples: Only massive changes in government policies will prevent the peso going into free fall (= falling quickly in value by a large amount).
The economy began to stabilize after months of near freefall.

body_content.explanation: to fall quickly under the influence of gravity (= the force that attracts objects towards one another, especially the force that makes things fall to the ground):
examples: The plane dropped very suddenly and seemed to freefall for more than 15 seconds.
I felt as though I was fainting, as if I was freefalling.

body_content.explanation: to fail or lose value or strength quickly and continuously:
examples: The company faced an uncertain future when the share price of its stock began to freefall.

body_content.explanation: to progress very quickly and in an uncontrolled way to reach a particular result:
examples: The clumsy scene comes as the movie is freefalling toward a conclusion.
